<result><read_file path="test/services/close_service_test.rb">require "test_helper"

class CloseService::CreateDraftSmsTest < ActiveSupport::TestCase
  sample_body = {
    text: "testing",
    local_phone: "5101112233",
    remote_phone: "5101112233",
    contact_id: "20",
    lead_id: "21",
    direction: "outbound"
  }

  test "succeeds when creating the sms" do
    stub_create_sms_request(
      status: 200,
      request_body: sample_body.merge(status: "draft"),
      response_body: {}
    )

    result = CloseService.new.create_draft_sms(sample_body)

    assert result.success?
  end

  test "fails when there's an error creating the sms" do
    stub_create_sms_request(
      status: 400,
      request_body: sample_body.merge(status: "draft"),
      response_body: {
        "error" => "Error 0",
        "errors" => ["Error 1", "Error 2"],
        "field-errors" => ["Error 3"],
        "should_be_ignored" => ["Non-error"]
      }
    )

    result = CloseService.new.create_draft_sms(sample_body)

    assert result.failure?
    assert_equal ["Error 0", "Error 1", "Error 2", "Error 3"], result.error.sort
  end

  test "raises an exception when hitting the rate limit" do
    stub_create_sms_request(
      status: 429,
      request_body: sample_body.merge(status: "draft"),
      response_body: {"rate_reset" => 5}
    )
    error_message = "The API has hit the rate limit"

    error = assert_exception(CloseService::RateLimitError, error_message) do |error|
      CloseService.new.create_draft_sms(sample_body)
    end

    assert_equal 5, error.rate_reset
  end

  def stub_create_sms_request(status: 200, request_body: {}, response_body: {})
    stub_request(:post, "https://api.close.com/api/v1/activity/sms/")
      .with(body: request_body.to_json)
      .to_return(
        status: status,
        body: response_body.to_json,
        headers: {"Content-Type" => "application/json"}
      )
  end
end

class CloseService::FetchAllSentSmsRecordsForTest < ActiveSupport::TestCase
  test "deep pagination" do
    lead = Close::Lead.new(id: "lead_id")
    first_response = {has_more: true}
    last_response = {has_more: false}

    stub_request(:get, close_list_sms_path(lead_id: lead.id, limit: 100, skip: 0)).to_return_json(body: first_response)
    stub_request(:get, close_list_sms_path(lead_id: lead.id, limit: 100, skip: 100)).to_return_json(body: last_response)

    CloseService.new.fetch_all_sent_sms_records_for(lead)

    assert_requested :get, close_list_sms_path(lead_id: lead.id, limit: 100, skip: 0), times: 1
    assert_requested :get, close_list_sms_path(lead_id: lead.id, limit: 100, skip: 100), times: 1
  end

  test "returns list of rich objects sorted by activity_at" do
    freeze_time

    lead = Close::Lead.new(id: "lead_id")
    response = {
      has_more: false,
      data: [
        {direction: "outbound", text: "ignored", status: "draft", activity_at: 5.minutes.ago},
        {direction: "inbound", text: "second", status: "inbox", activity_at: 10.minutes.ago},
        {direction: "inbound", text: "first", status: "inbox", activity_at: 15.minutes.ago}
      ]
    }

    stub_request(:get, close_list_sms_path(lead_id: lead.id, limit: 100, skip: 0)).to_return_json(body: response)

    result = CloseService.new.fetch_all_sent_sms_records_for(lead)

    assert_equal 2, result.size
    assert_equal "first", result.first.text
    assert_equal "inbox", result.first.status
    assert_equal "inbound", result.first.direction
    assert_equal 15.minutes.ago.iso8601, result.first.activity_at.iso8601
  end

  test "ignores anything other than sent and inbox" do
    freeze_time

    lead = Close::Lead.new(id: "lead_id")
    response = {
      has_more: false,
      data: [
        {direction: "inbound", text: "accepted", status: "inbox", activity_at: Time.current},
        {direction: "outbound", text: "accepted", status: "sent", activity_at: Time.current},
        {direction: "outbound", text: "ignored", status: "draft", activity_at: Time.current},
        {direction: "outbound", text: "ignored", status: "scheduled", activity_at: Time.current},
        {direction: "outbound", text: "ignored", status: "outbox", activity_at: Time.current}
      ]
    }

    stub_request(:get, close_list_sms_path(lead_id: lead.id, limit: 100, skip: 0)).to_return_json(body: response)

    result = CloseService.new.fetch_all_sent_sms_records_for(lead)

    assert_equal %w[accepted accepted], result.map(&:text)
  end

  private

  def close_list_sms_path(lead_id:, limit:, skip:)
    "https://api.close.com/api/v1/activity/sms/?lead_id=#{lead_id}&_limit=#{limit}&_skip=#{skip}"
  end
end

class CloseService::Sms::ToChatMessageTest < ActiveSupport::TestCase
  test "inbound message" do
    lead = Close::Lead.new(display_name: "Martin Westport", contacts: [
      {display_name: "Martin Westport", id: "contact_id"}
    ])
    sms = CloseService::Sms.new(lead:, text: "Hello", direction: "inbound", contact_id: "contact_id")

    content = sms.to_chat_message.content

    assert_equal "From Martin Westport: Hello", content
  end

  test "outbound message" do
    lead = Close::Lead.new
    sms = CloseService::Sms.new(lead:, text: "expected", direction: "outbound", contact_id: "contact_id")

    content = sms.to_chat_message.content

    assert_equal "expected", content
  end

  test "missing contact_id" do
    lead = Close::Lead.new
    sms = CloseService::Sms.new(lead:, text: "expected", direction: "inbound", contact_id: nil)

    content = sms.to_chat_message.content

    assert_equal "expected", content
  end

  test "missing lead" do
    sms = CloseService::Sms.new(lead: nil, text: "expected", direction: "inbound", contact_id: "contact_id")
    content = sms.to_chat_message.content

    assert_equal "expected", content
  end
end

class CloseService::Call::ToChatMessageTest < ActiveSupport::TestCase
  test "converts to chat message" do
    now = Time.current
    utterances = [
      CloseService::Utterance.new(text: "Hello!", speaker_label: "Clara Barton"),
      CloseService::Utterance.new(text: "Hola!", speaker_label: "Honest Abe")
    ]
    call = CloseService::Call.new(
      utterances:,
      direction: "inbound",
      activity_at: now,
      close_user_name: "Clara Barton",
      contact_name: "Honest Abe"
    )

    message = call.to_chat_message
    expected_text = <<~EOS.chomp
      On #{now.to_formatted_s(:long)}, the customer, Honest Abe, called Clara and Clara Barton answered. \
      Here is the transcript:\n\nClara Barton: Hello!\n\nHonest Abe: Hola!
    EOS
    assert_equal "user", message.role
    assert_equal expected_text, message.content
  end
end

<read_file path="app/services/close_copy_service.rb">class CloseCopyService < ApplicationService
  def initialize
    prod_api_key = Rails.application.credentials.dig!(:close, :production_api_key)
    dev_api_key = Rails.application.credentials.dig!(:close, :development_api_key)

    @prod_service = CloseService.new(prod_api_key)
    @dev_service = CloseService.new(dev_api_key)
  end

  def copy_lead_statuses
    statuses = @prod_service.fetch_lead_statuses.payload["data"]

    statuses.each do |status|
      payload = status.as_json
      payload.delete "organization_id"
      @dev_service.create_lead_status(payload)
    end
  end

  def copy_custom_lead_fields
    custom_fields = @prod_service.fetch_custom_lead_fields.payload["data"]

    custom_fields.each do |custom_field|
      payload = custom_field.as_json.except(
        "organization_id",
        "date_created",
        "date_updated",
        "created_by",
        "updated_by"
      )
      @dev_service.create_custom_lead_field(payload)
    end
  end
end

<read_file path="app/services/close_service.rb"># We monkey patch this to allow for the style of array param that Close
# expects, which is of the form foo=1,2,3 rather than the options Faraday
# provides, which are foo[]=1&foo[]=2&foo[]=3 or foo=1&foo=2&foo=3
module Faraday::EncodeMethods
  def encode_array(parent, value)
    "#{parent}=#{value.join(",")}"
  end
end

class CloseService < ApplicationService
  class Sms
    include ActiveModel::Model
    include ActiveModel::Attributes

    attribute :text
    attribute :direction
    attribute :status
    attribute :activity_at, :datetime
    attribute :contact_id
    attribute :lead

    def to_chat_message
      ::Chat::Message.new(role:, content:)
    end

    private

    def role
      case direction
      when "inbound"
        "user"
      when "outbound"
        "assistant"
      end
    end

    def content
      return text if contact_id.nil?

      if direction == "inbound" && (actor = lead&.actor(contact_id))
        "From #{actor}: " + text
      else
        text
      end
    end
  end

  class Utterance
    include ActiveModel::Model
    include ActiveModel::Attributes

    attribute :speaker_label
    attribute :text

    def formatted_text
      "#{speaker_label}: #{text}"
    end
  end

  class Call
    include ActiveModel::Model
    include ActiveModel::Attributes

    attribute :utterances
    attribute :direction
    attribute :activity_at, :datetime
    attribute :close_user_name
    attribute :contact_name

    def to_chat_message
      ::Chat::Message.new(role: "user", content: formatted_text)
    end

    private

    def call_info
      if direction == "inbound"
        "the customer, #{contact_name}, called Clara and #{close_user_name} answered"
      else
        "#{close_user_name} from Clara called the customer, #{contact_name}"
      end
    end

    def formatted_text
      "On #{activity_at.to_formatted_s(:long)}, #{call_info}. Here is the transcript:\n\n#{utterances.map(&:formatted_text).join("\n\n")}"
    end
  end

  class RateLimitError < StandardError
    attr_reader :rate_reset

    def initialize(rate_reset:)
      @rate_reset = rate_reset
      super("The API has hit the rate limit")
    end
  end

  ERROR_KEYS = ["errors", "error", "field-errors"].freeze

  def initialize(api_key = nil)
    api_key ||= Rails.application.credentials.dig!(:close, :api_key)
    @client = Closeio::Client.new api_key, false
  end

  def fetch_lead(lead_id)
    result = client.find_lead lead_id
    if result["error"]
      failure result["error"]
    else
      success Close::Lead.from_lead_payload(result)
    end
  end

  def create_lead(lead_data)
    result = @client.create_lead lead_data
    if result["error"]
      Rails.logger.error "Failed to create Close.io lead: #{result["error"]}"
      failure result["error"]
    elsif result["field-errors"]
      Rails.logger.error "Failed to create Close.io lead: #{result["field-errors"]}"
      failure result["field-errors"]
    else
      Rails.logger.error "Successfully saved lead data to Close with lead id #{result["id"]}"
      success result
    end
  end

  def fetch_lead_statuses
    to_result @client.list_lead_statuses
  end

  def create_lead_status(status_data)
    to_result @client.create_lead_status(status_data)
  end

  def fetch_custom_lead_fields
    to_result @client.list_custom_fields
  end

  def create_custom_lead_field(status_data)
    to_result @client.create_custom_field(status_data)
  end

  def create_opportunity(opportunity_data)
    result = @client.create_opportunity opportunity_data
    if result["error"]
      Rails.logger.error "Failed to create Close.io opportunity: #{result["error"]}"
      failure result["error"]
    elsif result["field-errors"]
      Rails.logger.error "Failed to create Close.io opportunity: #{result["field-errors"]}"
      failure result["field-errors"]
    else
      Rails.logger.error "Successfully saved opportunity data to Close with opportunity id #{result["id"]}"
      success result
    end
  end

  def search(advanced_filter_query)
    result = @client.filter advanced_filter_query
    if result["error"]
      Rails.logger.error "Failed to execute search query: #{result["error"]}"
      failure result["error"]
    elsif result["field-errors"]
      Rails.logger.error "Failed to execute search query: #{result["field-errors"]}"
      failure result["field-errors"]
    else
      success result
    end
  end

  def delete_webhook(subscription_id)
    to_result @client.delete_webhook(subscription_id)
  end

  def create_webhook(opts)
    to_result @client.create_webhook(opts)
  end

  def create_draft_sms(opts)
    default_opts = {status: "draft"}
    to_result @client.create_sms(opts.merge(default_opts))
  end

  def fetch_all_activity_for(lead)
    sms_records = fetch_all_sent_sms_records_for(lead)
    call_records = fetch_all_call_records_for(lead)

    (sms_records + call_records).sort_by(&:activity_at)
  end

  def list_sms(opts = {})
    to_result @client.list_sms(opts)
  end

  def fetch_all_sent_sms_records_for(lead)
    limit = 100
    skip = 0
    results = []

    loop do
      payload = list_sms(lead_id: lead.id, _limit: limit, _skip: skip).payload
      final_page = payload.fetch(:has_more, false)

      records = payload.fetch(:data, []).filter_map do
        Sms.new(**_1.slice(:text, :direction, :status, :activity_at, :contact_id), lead:) if _1[:status].presence_in %w[inbox sent]
      end
      results.concat records

      break unless final_page

      skip += limit
    end

    results.sort_by(&:activity_at)
  end

  def list_calls(opts = {})
    to_result @client.list_calls(opts)
  end

  def fetch_all_call_records_for(lead)
    _fields = ["recording_transcript", "disposition", "direction", "activity_at"]
    _limit = 100
    _skip = 0
    results = []

    loop do
      payload = list_calls(lead_id: lead.id, _limit:, _skip:, _fields:).payload
      final_page = payload.fetch(:has_more, false)

      records = payload.fetch(:data, []).filter_map do |call|
        # We only care about calls that were answered and transcribed
        next unless call[:disposition] == "answered" && call[:recording_transcript].present?
        utterances = call.dig!(:recording_transcript, :utterances).map do
          Utterance.new(**_1.slice(:text, :speaker_label))
        end
        Call.new(
          utterances:,
          direction: call[:direction],
          activity_at: call[:activity_at],
          close_user_name: call.dig!(:recording_transcript, :speakers).find { _1[:speaker_side] == "close-user" }.dig(:speaker_label),
          contact_name: call.dig!(:recording_transcript, :speakers).find { _1[:speaker_side] == "contact" }.dig(:speaker_label)
        )
      end
      results.concat records

      break unless final_page
      skip + limit
    end

    results
  end

  def fetch_all_caregivers(*fields)
    default_fields = ["id", "html_url", "custom", "contacts", "display_name", "addresses"]
    lead_fields = fields | default_fields

    results = []
    cursor = nil
    loop do
      search_result = search({
        _limit: 100,
        query: ALL_CAREGIVERS_QUERY,
        _fields: {
          lead: lead_fields
        },
        cursor: cursor
      })
      if search_result.failure?
        Rails.logger.error "Search all failed #{search_result.error}"
        return results
      end
      cursor = search_result.payload["cursor"]
      search_result.payload["data"].each do |lead_data|
        results << Close::Lead.from_lead_payload(lead_data)
      end
      break if cursor.nil?
    end
    results
  end

  private

  def to_result(result)
    if (rate_reset = result["rate_reset"].presence)
      raise RateLimitError.new(rate_reset:)
    elsif ERROR_KEYS.any? { result.key?(_1) }
      errors = result.values_at(*ERROR_KEYS).compact.flatten
      failure errors
    else
      success result.with_indifferent_access
    end
  end

  ALL_CAREGIVERS_QUERY = {
    negate: false,
    queries: [
      {negate: false, object_type: "lead", type: "object_type"},
      {
        negate: false,
        queries: [
          {
            negate: false,
            queries: [
              {
                condition: {type: "term", values: ["Caregiver"]},
                field: {custom_field_id: "cf_NiRkw6ZyvZ1YceHykSqLGzz5MWlNIJo2XCtHPAtX3Te", type: "custom_field"},
                negate: false,
                type: "field_condition"
              }
            ],
            type: "and"
          }
        ],
        type: "and"
      }
    ],
    type: "and"
  }.freeze
end

<read_file path="app/models/close_sms.rb"># == Schema Information
#
# Table name: close_sms
#
#  id              :bigint           not null, primary key
#  ai_generated    :boolean          default(FALSE), not null
#  close_timestamp :datetime         not null
#  deleted_at      :datetime
#  direction       :integer          not null
#  local_phone     :string           not null
#  remote_phone    :string           not null
#  sent_at         :datetime
#  sent_text       :text
#  status          :integer          not null
#  text            :text             not null
#  created_at      :datetime         not null
#  updated_at      :datetime         not null
#  close_id        :string           not null
#  contact_id      :string           not null
#  lead_id         :string           not null
#  parent_id       :bigint
#
# Indexes
#
#  index_close_sms_on_close_id   (close_id) UNIQUE
#  index_close_sms_on_parent_id  (parent_id)
#
# Foreign Keys
#
#  fk_rails_...  (parent_id => close_sms.id)
#
class CloseSms < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :parent, class_name: "CloseSms", optional: true
  has_one :response, class_name: "CloseSms", foreign_key: "parent_id"

  enum :direction, inbound: 0, outbound: 1
  enum :status, inbox: 0, draft: 1, scheduled: 2, outbox: 3, sent: 4, deleted: 5

  scope :ai_generated, -> { where(ai_generated: true) }

  scope :ai_generated, -> { where(ai_generated: true) }

  validates :direction, :status, presence: true
end

<read_file path="app/jobs/webhooks/close/draft_sms_sent_job.rb">class Webhooks::Close::DraftSmsSentJob < ApplicationJob
  discard_on ActiveRecord::RecordNotFound

  queue_as :default

  def perform(inbound_webhook)
    InboundWebhook.process(inbound_webhook) do
      data = inbound_webhook.body.with_indifferent_access.dig!(:event, :data)

      close_id = data.fetch(:id)
      sms = CloseSms.ai_generated.draft.find_by!(close_id:)

      sms.update! status: :sent, sent_text: data.fetch(:text), sent_at: data.fetch(:date_sent)
    end
  end
end
</read_file>
<read_file path="test/jobs/webhooks/close/draft_sms_sent_job_test.rb">require "test_helper"

class Webhooks::Close::DraftSmsSentJobTest < ActiveJob::TestCase
  test "marks existing draft as sent" do
    payload = {event: {data: {id: "close-id", text: "text", date_sent: Time.current}}}
    inbound_webhook = create(:inbound_webhook, body: payload)
    sms = create(:close_sms, :draft, ai_generated: true, close_id: "close-id")

    assert_changes -> { sms.reload.status }, from: "draft", to: "sent" do
      Webhooks::Close::DraftSmsSentJob.perform_now(inbound_webhook)
    end
  end

  test "updates text from webhook" do
    payload = {event: {data: {id: "close-id", text: "updated", date_sent: Time.current}}}
    inbound_webhook = create(:inbound_webhook, body: payload)
    sms = create(:close_sms, :draft, sent_text: nil, ai_generated: true, close_id: "close-id")

    assert_changes -> { sms.reload.sent_text }, from: nil, to: "updated" do
      Webhooks::Close::DraftSmsSentJob.perform_now(inbound_webhook)
    end
  end

  test "updates sent_at from webhook" do
    payload = {event: {data: {id: "close-id", text: "text", date_sent: Time.new(1989, 12, 31, 0, 0, 0)}}}
    inbound_webhook = create(:inbound_webhook, body: payload)
    sms = create(:close_sms, :draft, sent_text: nil, ai_generated: true, close_id: "close-id")

    assert_changes -> { sms.reload.sent_at }, from: nil, to: Time.new(1989, 12, 31, 0, 0, 0) do
      Webhooks::Close::DraftSmsSentJob.perform_now(inbound_webhook)
    end
  end

  test "marks webhook as processed" do
    payload = {event: {data: {id: "close-id", text: "text", date_sent: Time.current}}}
    inbound_webhook = create(:inbound_webhook, body: payload)
    create(:close_sms, :draft, ai_generated: true, close_id: "close-id")

    assert_changes -> { inbound_webhook.reload.status }, from: "pending", to: "processed" do
      Webhooks::Close::DraftSmsSentJob.perform_now(inbound_webhook)
    end
  end

  test "tracks inbound SMS events" do
    assert_difference "InboundWebhook.count", 1 do

          "close-sig-timestamp" => "1740088457"
        }
      )
    end

    webhook = InboundWebhook
      .where("body #>> Array['event', 'id'] = 'ev_7eNazr9qg4cgQ84YSKI7xT'")

    assert_enqueued_with job: Webhooks::Close::SmsCreatedJob, args: webhook
    assert_equal JSON.parse(sms_created_payload), webhook.first!.body
    assert_response :ok
  end

  test "enqueues Webhooks::Close::DraftSmsSentJob when an SMS is sent from Close" do
    payload = {subscription_id: @sub_id, event: {object_type: "activity.sms", action: "sent", data: {direction: "outbound"}}}.to_json

    assert_difference "InboundWebhook.count", 1 do
      post(
        webhooks_close_webhooks_url,
        env: {"RAW_POST_DATA" => payload},
        headers: close_auth_headers_for(payload)
      )
    end

    inbound_webhook = InboundWebhook.last!

    assert_enqueued_with job: Webhooks::Close::DraftSmsSentJob, args: [inbound_webhook]
  end

  test "ignores unsupported actions" do
    payload = {subscription_id: @sub_id, event: {id: "bad-action", action: "sent", object_type: "activity.sms", data: {direction: "inbound"}}}.to_json

    assert_difference "InboundWebhook.count", 1 do
      assert_exception StandardError, /unsupported event: activity.sms, sent, inbound/i do
        post(
          webhooks_close_webhooks_url,
          env: {"RAW_POST_DATA" => payload},
          headers: close_auth_headers_for(payload)
        )
      end
    end

    assert_no_enqueued_jobs
  end

  test "enqueues Webhooks::Close::SmsDeletedJob when a draft SMS is deleted from Close" do
    payload = {subscription_id: @sub_id, event: {action: "deleted", object_type: "activity.sms", data: {}}}.to_json

    assert_difference "InboundWebhook.count", 1 do
      post(
        webhooks_close_webhooks_url,
        env: {"RAW_POST_DATA" => payload},
        headers: close_auth_headers_for(payload)
      )
    end

    inbound_webhook = InboundWebhook.last!

    assert_enqueued_with job: Webhooks::Close::SmsDeletedJob, args: [inbound_webhook]
  end

  test "ignores unsupported directions" do
    payload = {subscription_id: @sub_id, event: {id: "bad-action", action: "created", object_type: "activity.sms", data: {direction: "outbound"}}}.to_json

    assert_difference "InboundWebhook.count", 1 do
      assert_exception StandardError, /unsupported event: activity.sms, created, outbound/i do
        post(
          webhooks_close_webhooks_url,
          env: {"RAW_POST_DATA" => payload},
          headers: close_auth_headers_for(payload)
        )
      end
    end

    assert_no_enqueued_jobs
  end

  test "raises an exception when webhook is unknown" do
    payload = {subscription_id: @sub_id, event: {id: "bad-event", object_type: "bananas", data: {}}}.to_json

    assert_difference "InboundWebhook.count", 1 do
      assert_exception StandardError, /unsupported event: bananas/i do
        post(
          webhooks_close_webhooks_url,
          env: {"RAW_POST_DATA" => payload},
          headers: close_auth_headers_for(payload)
        )
      end
    end

    webhook = InboundWebhook
      .find_by("body #>> Array['event', 'id'] = 'bad-event'")

    assert webhook
    assert_equal JSON.parse(payload), webhook.body
    assert_no_performed_jobs
  end

  test "requires valid signature" do
    post(
      webhooks_close_webhooks_url,
      env: {"RAW_POST_DATA" => sms_created_payload},
      headers: {"close-sig-hash" => "junk", "close-sig-timestamp" => "junk"}
    )

    assert_response :unauthorized
  end

  test "requires expected headers" do
    post(
      webhooks_close_webhooks_url,
      env: {"RAW_POST_DATA" => sms_created_payload},
      headers: {}
    )

    assert_response :unauthorized
  end

  def close_auth_headers_for(payload)
    close_sig_timestamp = Time.current.iso8601
    data = close_sig_timestamp + payload
    close_sig_hash = OpenSSL::HMAC.hexdigest(OpenSSL::Digest.new("sha256"), [@signature_key].pack("H*"), data)

    {
      "close-sig-hash" => close_sig_hash,
      "close-sig-timestamp" => close_sig_timestamp
    }
  end

  def sms_created_payload
    file_fixture("webhooks/close/sms_created.json").read.delete("\n").squish.strip.gsub(/{ /, "{").gsub(/ }/, "}")
  end
end

<read_file path="lib/tasks/configure_close_webhooks.rake">desc "Configure Close webhooks for this environment. Mode options: keep (default), recreate"
task :configure_close_webhooks, [:mode] => [:environment] do |task, args|
  mode = (args[:mode] || "keep").downcase
  unless ["keep", "recreate"].include?(mode)
    raise ArgumentError, "Invalid mode. Must be 'keep' or 'recreate'"
  end

  def l(message)
    puts "[ rake/configure_close_webhooks ] #{message}"
  end

  # https://developer.close.com/resources/webhook-subscriptions/webhook-filters/#create-new-webhook-subscription-with-filters
  def subscriptions
    [
      {
        object_type: "activity.sms",
        action: "created",
        extra_filter: {
          type: "field_accessor",
          field: "data",
          filter: {
            field: "direction",
            type: "field_accessor",
            filter: {
              type: "equals",
              value: "inbound"
            }
          }
        }
      },
      {
        object_type: "activity.sms",
        action: "sent",
        extra_filter: {
          type: "field_accessor",
          field: "data",
          filter: {
            field: "direction",
            type: "field_accessor",
            filter: {
              type: "equals",
              value: "outbound"
            }
          }
        }
      },
      {
        object_type: "activity.sms",
        action: "deleted"
      }
    ]
  end

  client = CloseService.new

  subscriptions.each do |subscription|
    subscription => { object_type:, action: }
    existing_subscription = Close::WebhookSubscription.find_by(object_type: object_type, action: action)
    if existing_subscription.present?
      l "Found existing subscription for #{object_type}##{action}"
      if mode == "recreate"
        l "Replacing existing subscription for #{object_type}##{action}"
        l "Deleting remote subscription with close id #{existing_subscription.subscription_id}"
        result = client.delete_webhook(existing_subscription.subscription_id)

        if result.failure?
          l "Failed to delete remote subscription with close id #{existing_subscription.subscription_id}: #{result.error}"
          next
        end

        l "Destroying local subscription record with id #{existing_subscription.id}"
        existing_subscription.destroy!
      else
        l "Keeping existing subscription with close id #{existing_subscription.subscription_id} and database id #{existing_subscription.id}"
        next
      end
    else
      l "No existing subscription for #{object_type}##{action} -- creating one"
    end

    subscription_result = client.create_webhook({
      url: Rails.application.routes.url_helpers.webhooks_close_webhooks_url,
      events: [subscription]
    })

    if subscription_result.payload.fetch("message", "").include?("Duplicate active subscription")
      subscription_id = subscription_result.payload.fetch("message").split(" ").last.split(".").first

      client.delete_webhook(subscription_id)
      subscription_result = client.create_webhook({
        url: Rails.application.routes.url_helpers.webhooks_close_webhooks_url,
        events: [subscription]
      })
    end

    if subscription_result.failure?
      l "Failed to create remote subscription: #{subscription_result.error}"
      next
    end

    subscription = subscription_result.payload
    l "Created remote subscription with close id #{subscription["id"]}"
    new_subscription = Close::WebhookSubscription.create!({
      subscription_id: subscription["id"],
      signature_key: subscription["signature_key"],
      status: subscription["status"],
      action: action,
      object_type: object_type
    })
    l "Created local subscription record with id #{new_subscription.id}"
  end
end

<read_file path="test/rake_tasks/configure_close_webhooks_test.rb">require "rake_test_case"

class ConfigureCloseWebhooksTest < RakeTestCase
  include TestOptions.new(vcr: true)

  test "can configure with no existing subscriptions" do
    output = capture_stdout do
      assert_difference -> { Close::WebhookSubscription.count }, 3 do
        invoke_task
      end
    end

    assert_match(/No existing subscription for activity.sms#created/, output)
    assert_match(/Created remote subscription/, output)
    assert_match(/Created local subscription/, output)

    created_subscription = Close::WebhookSubscription.find_by!(object_type: "activity.sms", action: "created")
    sent_subscription = Close::WebhookSubscription.find_by!(object_type: "activity.sms", action: "sent")

    assert_equal "activity.sms", created_subscription.object_type
    assert_equal "created", created_subscription.action
    assert_equal "activity.sms", sent_subscription.object_type
    assert_equal "sent", sent_subscription.action
  end

  test "can be run mutliple times in keep mode" do
    assert_difference -> { Close::WebhookSubscription.count }, 3 do
      capture_stdout { invoke_task }
    end

    subscription = Close::WebhookSubscription.find_by!(object_type: "activity.sms", action: "created")

    assert_equal "activity.sms", subscription.object_type
    assert_equal "created", subscription.action

    assert_no_difference -> { Close::WebhookSubscription.count }, 3 do
      capture_stdout { invoke_task }
    end
  end

  test "can configure with existing subscription in keep mode" do
    existing_sub = create(:close_webhook_subscription, object_type: "activity.sms", action: "created")

    output = capture_stdout do
      invoke_task
    end

    assert_match(/Found existing subscription for activity.sms#created/, output)
    assert_match(/Keeping existing subscription/, output)
    assert Close::WebhookSubscription.find existing_sub.id
  end

  test "can configure with existing subscription in recreate mode" do
    existing_sub = create(:close_webhook_subscription, object_type: "activity.sms", action: "created", subscription_id: "1")
    create(:close_webhook_subscription, object_type: "activity.sms", action: "sent", subscription_id: "2")
    create(:close_webhook_subscription, object_type: "activity.sms", action: "deleted", subscription_id: "3")

    output = capture_stdout do
      assert_no_difference -> { Close::WebhookSubscription.count } do
        invoke_task "recreate"
      end
    end

    assert_match(/Found existing subscription for activity.sms#created/, output)
    assert_match(/Replacing existing subscription for activity.sms#created/, output)
    assert_match(/Deleting remote subscription/, output)
    assert_match(/Destroying local subscription/, output)

    subscription = Close::WebhookSubscription.find_by!(object_type: "activity.sms", action: "created")
    assert_not_equal existing_sub.id, subscription.id
  end

  test "can be run mutliple times in recreate mode" do
    existing_sub = create(:close_webhook_subscription, object_type: "activity.sms", action: "created", subscription_id: "1")
    create(:close_webhook_subscription, object_type: "activity.sms", action: "sent", subscription_id: "2")
    create(:close_webhook_subscription, object_type: "activity.sms", action: "deleted", subscription_id: "3")

    assert_no_difference -> { Close::WebhookSubscription.count } do
      capture_stdout { invoke_task "recreate" }
    end

    subscription = Close::WebhookSubscription.find_by!(object_type: "activity.sms", action: "created")
    assert_not_equal existing_sub.id, subscription.id

    assert_no_difference -> { Close::WebhookSubscription.count } do
      capture_stdout { invoke_task "recreate" }
    end
  end

  test "can be run in keep mode followed by recreate mode" do
    assert_nothing_raised do
      capture_stdout { invoke_task "keep" }
      capture_stdout { invoke_task "recreate" }
    end
  end
end

<read_file path="app/services/close_copy_service.rb">class CloseCopyService < ApplicationService
  def initialize
    prod_api_key = Rails.application.credentials.dig!(:close, :production_api_key)
    dev_api_key = Rails.application.credentials.dig!(:close, :development_api_key)

    @prod_service = CloseService.new(prod_api_key)
    @dev_service = CloseService.new(dev_api_key)
  end

  def copy_lead_statuses
    result = @prod_service.fetch_lead_statuses

    if result.failure?
      Rails.logger.error "Error fetching lead statuses from production: #{result.error}"
      return result
    end

    statuses = result.payload["data"]

    statuses.each do |status|
      payload = status.as_json
      payload.delete "organization_id"
      @dev_service.create_lead_status(payload)
    end
    success
  end

  def copy_custom_lead_fields
    result = @prod_service.fetch_custom_lead_fields

    if result.failure?
      Rails.logger.error "Error fetching custom fields from production: #{result.error}"
      return result
    end

    custom_fields = result.payload["data"]

    custom_fields.each do |custom_field|
      payload = custom_field.as_json.except(
        "organization_id",
        "date_created",
        "date_updated",
        "created_by",
        "updated_by"
      )
      @dev_service.create_custom_lead_field(payload)
    end
  end
end

<read_file path="test/support/test_options.rb">require_relative "vcr"

### Using TestOptions
#
# TestOptions is a Minitest extension that enables setup functionality
# at the test declaration level. This allows you to declaratively
# control test behavior through options passed at the class or
# individual test level.
#
# Use TestOptions for contextual/generic behavior that is not
# essential for understanding the test's purpose, such as VCR,
# freezing time, environment variables, etc.
#
# For example, if you've registered a VCR test helper with
# TestOptions, you can enable VCR for all tests in a Minitest file
# like this:
#
#   include TestOptions.new(vcr: true)
#
# With `vcr: true`, VCR will run for all tests with the default
# options.
#
# You can also provide default VCR options that apply to all tests:
#
#   include TestOptions.new(vcr: {match_requests_on: [:uri, :body]})
#
# Or override those options on a per-test basis:
#
#   test "my test", vcr: {match_requests_on: [:uri, :method]} do
#     # ...
#   end
#
# If no options are provided for a test, the default options (if any)
# will be used.
#
# You can also opt out of VCR for an individual test if it was
# enabled for all tests:
#
#   include TestOptions.new(vcr: true)
#
#   test "my test", vcr: false do
#     # ...
#   end
#
# Or even, you can opt out of VCR for the entire file but enable it on
# a per-test basis:
#
#   include TestOptions.new
#
#   test "my test 1" do
#     # ...
#   end
#
#   test "my test 2", vcr: true do
#     # ...
#   end
#
### Registering Helper Extensions
#
# You can extend TestOptions by registering custom helper extensions.
# A helper is a module or class that responds to the following
# methods:
#
# Note: `test_options` refers to either the test-specific options or
# the default options if no specific ones are provided. It includes
# configuration for all registered helper extensions.
#
# - `configure_extension(test_class, test_options)`  A hook that runs
#   before each test's setup. Use it to include modules, extend the
#   test class, or perform other setup actions. Check whether the
#   relevant options for your extension are present in `test_options`
#   before applying any configuration.
#
# - `setup(test_object, test_options)`  Runs during the Minitest
#   `setup` phase, before each test. `test_object` is the current test
#   instance.
#
# - `teardown(test_object, test_options)`  Runs during the Minitest
#   `teardown` phase, after each test. Works similarly to
#   `setup`.
class TestOptions < Module
  module Core
    def test(test_name, **options, &)
      test_name = test_name.gsub(/\s+/, "_")

      if options.any?
        test_options << [test_name, options]
      end

      super(test_name, &)
    end

    def test_options_for(current_test_name)
      current_test_name = current_test_name.sub(/^test_/, "")

      test_options.find do |test_name, test_options|
        if test_name == current_test_name
          break test_options
        end
      end
    end

    def test_options
      @test_options ||= []
    end
  end

  class_attribute :helpers, default: []

  def self.register_helper(helper)
    helpers << helper
  end

  def initialize(**default_options)
    define_singleton_method :included do |test_class|
      test_class.extend Core

      get_options = ->(test_object) do
        test_name = test_object.name
        test_options = test_object.class.test_options_for(test_name)

        default_options.merge(test_options || {})
      end

      self.class.helpers.each do |helper|
        helper.configure_extension(test_class, default_options)

        test_class.setup do
          options = get_options.call(self)
          helper.configure_extension(test_class, options)
          helper.setup(self, options)
        end

        test_class.teardown do
          options = get_options.call(self)
          helper.teardown(self, options)
        end
      end
    end
  end
end

<read_file path="test/support/output.rb">module OutputTestHelper
  def capture_stdout
    original_stdout = $stdout
    $stdout = StringIO.new
    yield $stdout
    $stdout.string
  ensure
    $stdout = original_stdout
  end

  def silence_stdout(&block)
    ret = nil
    capture_stdout do
      ret = block.call
    end
    ret
  end
end

<read_file path="test/support/vcr.rb">module VcrTestHelper
  extend ActiveSupport::Concern

  # Provides a VCR matcher that ignores parameters that change in
  # every request, provided that you specify the patterns.
  #
  # You can specify the matcher on the fly when passing the options:
  #
  #   {match_requests_on: [:uri, :method, body_excluding(...)]}
  #
  # @param patterns [Array[Regexp, String]] Each pattern must be a
  # tuple with a regex and its replacement string
  def self.body_excluding(*patterns)
    clean_body = ->(body) do
      patterns.reduce(body) do |body, (regex, replacement)|
        body.gsub(regex, replacement)
      end
    end

    ->(request_1, request_2) {
      clean_body.call(request_1.body) == clean_body.call(request_2.body)
    }
  end

  included do
    class_attribute :vcr_record, default: false
  end

  def recording?
    vcr_record || ENV["VCR_RECORD"]
  end

  class_methods do
    # Use to force record mode at development time: always perform
    # real http interactions and record fixtures
    def vcr_record!
      if ENV["CI"]
        raise "#vcr_record! is meant for dev time and shouldn't run in CI."
      end

      self.vcr_record = true
    end

    def body_excluding(*patterns)
      VcrTestHelper.body_excluding(*patterns)
    end
  end
end

# Extension meant to be registered with TestOptions. Adds VCR
# functionality at the test declaration level.
class VcrTestOptionsExtension
  extend ActiveSupport::Concern

  DEFAULT_MATCH_RULES = [:method, :uri, :body].freeze
  DEFAULT_OPTIONS = {allow_unused_http_interactions: false}.freeze

  def self.configure_extension(test_class, options)
    if options[:vcr] && test_class.ancestors.exclude?(VcrTestHelper)
      test_class.include VcrTestHelper
    end
  end

  def self.setup(test_object, options)
    options = options[:vcr]

    if options == :off
      VCR.turn_off!
    elsif options
      setup_vcr(test_object, options)
    end
  end

  private_class_method def self.setup_vcr(test_object, options)
    cassette_name, cassette_path = cassette_info_for(test_object)
    options = {} unless options.is_a?(Hash)

    unless options.key?(:record)
      record = test_object.recording? ? :all : :none
      options = options.merge(record:)
    end

    if options[:record] == :all && cassette_path.exist?
      cassette_path.unlink
    end

    options = DEFAULT_OPTIONS.merge(options)

    VCR.insert_cassette(cassette_name, **options)
  end

  def self.teardown(_test_class, options)
    options = options[:vcr]

    if options == :off
      VCR.turn_on!
    elsif options
      VCR.eject_cassette
    end
  end

  private_class_method def self.cassette_info_for(test_object)
    prefix = test_object.class.name.tableize.singularize
    name = "#{prefix}-#{test_object.name}".gsub(/[^[:word:]\-\/]+/, "_")
    path = Pathname(VCR.configuration.cassette_library_dir).join("#{name}.yml")

    [name, path]
  end
end

VCR.configure do |c|
  # This is the directory where VCR will store its "cassettes", i.e. its
  # recorded HTTP interactions.
  c.cassette_library_dir = "test/cassettes"

  # This line makes it so VCR and WebMock know how to talk to each other.
  c.hook_into :webmock

  # This line makes VCR ignore requests to localhost. This is necessary
  # even if WebMock's allow_localhost is set to true.
  c.ignore_localhost = true

  c.default_cassette_options = {
    match_requests_on: [:method, :uri, :body]
  }

  [
    ["<SYMMETRY_API_KEY>", [:symmetry, :api_key]],
    ["<CLOSE_API_KEY>", [:close, :api_key]],
    ["<OPENAI_ACCESS_TOKEN>", [:openai, :access_token]],
    ["<STRIPE_API_KEY>", [:stripe, :api_key]],
    ["<POSTHOG_API_KEY>", [:posthog, :api_key]],
    ["<INTERCOM_SECRET_KEY>", [:intercom, :secret_key]],
    ["<GMAPS_API_KEY>", [:google, :maps, :api_key]],
    ["<RECAPTCHA_API_KEY>", [:google, :recaptcha, :api_key]]
  ].each do |replacement, secret_path|
    c.filter_sensitive_data(replacement) do
      Rails.application.credentials.dig!(*secret_path)
    end
  end
end
